DOC.brief_title: Wall Shear Stress Neointimal Healing Following PCI Angulated Coronary Vessels
DOC.detailed_description: The past two decade register major advance cardiovascular medicine improve patient ' survival quality life . One area major research innovation field percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) , non-surgical procedure use treat narrowed heart artery stent . Stents metallic tubular support place inside blood vessel relieve obstruction restore blood flow heart muscle . Stents could also coat drug ( drug-eluting stent - DES ) improve local heal inhibits growth scar tissue ( smooth muscle fibrous cell ) within vessel otherwise could lead re-narrowing . The investigator study evaluate two FDA-approved DES , currently use , respect coronary vessel heal long term patency . These include XIENCE Xpedition Everolimus drug-eluting stent ( X-EES ) Abbott Vascular Resolute IntegrityÂ® Zotarolimus drug-eluting stent ( R-ZES ) Medtronic , Inc , show large clinical trial safe effective . This study evaluate effect apparently subtle difference stent design two platform may important effect regional plaque response blood flow dynamic immediately stent deployment stent heal scar formation 12 month follow . Several aspect R-ZES compare X-EES design may result favorable regional plaque response blood flow dynamic immediately stent deployment . These include compliant stent design make single sinusoidal wire connector strut likely comformable curve angulated coronary vessel . In heart vessel angulate , feature may make major difference outcome study already suggest . Whereas , narrow artery curve angulated , use X-EES could result straighten vessel 's natural curvature disturbance flow pattern . In contrast , use R-ZES angulated artery could cause less hemodynamic disturbance . There great deal data suggest disturbance local blood flow pattern creation eddy current ( 'turbulent ' blood flow ) could adversely affect stent heal exacerbate neointimal tissue growth . Using two intravascular image technology , optical coherence tomography ( OCT ) intravascular ultrasound ( IVUS ) , study aim investigate difference scar tissue coverage within stented region degree narrow edge stent patient undergo clinically-indicated PCI ( R-ZES X-EES ) 12-month follow-up .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient must 30 80 year old 2 . Severe coronary lesion vessel > 30 degree angulation require PCI 3 . Lesion treatable single Resolute Integrity Abbott Xience Xpedition coronary drug elute stent ( length 1538 mm ) . 4 . Evidence myocardial ischemia ( e.g. , stable unstable angina , postinfarct angina silent ischemia ) suitable PCI . Subjects stable angina silent ischemia < 70 % diameter stenosis must objective sign ischemia determine echocardiogram , nuclear scan , ambulatory ECG stress ECG . In absence noninvasive ischemia , fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) must do indicative ischemia . 1 . Inability provide inform consent prior randomization 2 . Anatomy require coronary artery bypass surgery ( CABG ) 3 . History prior CABG territory vessel consider PCI 4 . Heavily calcified lesion require rotablation debulking score device successful stent deployment 5 . Recent ( < 3 day ) STelevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) 6 . Systolic BP > 160mmHg diastolic BP > 100 mmHg hypotension ( BP < 90/60 mmHg ) 7 . Planned surgical procedure subsequent 6 month 8 . History hypersensitivity contraindication device material degradants , everolimus , zotarolimus , cobalt , chromium , nickel , platinum , tungsten , acrylic fluoro polymer 9 . History solid organ transplantation subject wait list solid organ transplant . 10 . Known allergy clinically utilized antithrombotic antiplatelet agent 11 . Unable tolerate long term dual antiplatelet therapy 12 . Pregnancy lactation 13 . Subject renal insufficiency define estimate GFR < 30 ml/min/1.73m2 .
